Course Description: THIS COURSE IS AN INTRODUCTION TO THE BASIC CONCEPTS, PRINCIPLES AND ENVIRONMENT OF FINANCIAL STATEMENT AUDITING. THE COURSE WILL EMPHASIZE THE AUDIT DECISION-MAKING PROCESS, RESEARCHING AUDIT STANDARDS, AUDIT PLANNING, EVIDENCE EVALUATION, AUDIT REPORTS, ETHICS, AND LEGAL LIABILITY.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
1. UNDERSTAND THE BASIC CONCEPTS THAT UNDERLIE THE AUDIT PROCESS: RISK, MATERIALITY, AND EVIDENCE. 
2. APPLY CONCEPTS TO THE REVENUE PROCESS, COMPLETING THE AUDIT, AND AUDIT REPORTING. 
3. UNDERSTAND THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN PROFESSIONAL CONDUCT AND LEGAL LIABILITY.
4. DEMONSTRATE COMPETENCE IN THE APPLICATION OF ASSURANCE SERVICE GUIDELINES.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
